problem:
Small and medium-sized businesses using WordPress often struggle to manage their financial activities in a simple, organized way. Most existing accounting solutions are either too complex (enterprise-level ERPs) or exist outside the WordPress environment, forcing users to rely on spreadsheets or third-party tools.

This creates several issues:

  • Fragmented workflow: Business owners have to switch between multiple platforms to track income, expenses, and customer invoices.

  • Lack of transparency: There is no centralized dashboard that summarizes key financial data within WordPress.

  • No native data control: Financial data is often stored in external systems, which limits customization and ownership.

  • Limited automation: Tasks like generating invoices, recording journal entries, or reconciling transactions are manual and error-prone.

As a result, users spend more time on bookkeeping tasks and less time running their actual business.
solution:
Develop a modular accounting plugin for WordPress called Aqn Accounting, designed to offer lightweight but robust financial management directly inside the WordPress dashboard.

Core Features

  1. Unified Accounting Dashboard

    • A clean, interactive dashboard that summarizes key metrics â€” total income, expenses, profit/loss, outstanding invoices, and recent transactions.

    • Role-based access for accountants, admins, and auditors.

  2. Ledger and Chart of Accounts

    • Introduce a customizable chart of accounts for managing assets, liabilities, income, and expenses.

    • Allow users to create new ledgers and assign them to specific transaction types.

  3. Transactions and Journals

    • Support double-entry bookkeeping principles.

    • Automatic debit-credit balancing checks to prevent invalid entries.

    • Enable manual journal entries and recurring transaction templates.

  4. Invoices and Billing

    • Built-in invoicing system to create, send, and track invoices from within WordPress.

    • Integration with common payment gateways (e.g., Stripe, PayPal, manual bank transfer).

    • Auto-post revenue entries when invoices are marked as paid.

  5. Reporting Module

    • Generate financial statements like Trial Balance, Profit & Loss, and Balance Sheet in real time.

    • Export reports in PDF or CSV format.

  6. Extensibility

    • Modular structure allowing third-party extensions (e.g., Payroll, Inventory, Tax Calculation).

    • All modules use the same accounting core and share a unified database structure.
